title: Santuario Nacional del Corazón de Jesús, Montevideo
text:
The National Shrine of the Sacred Heart of Jesus (), popularly known as Iglesia del Cerrito (due to its location on top of the <a href="Cerrito%2C%20Montevideo">Cerrito de la Victoria</a>) is a <a href="Roman%20Catholic">Roman Catholic</a> <a href="parish%20church">parish church</a> and <a href="national%20shrine">national shrine</a> in <a href="Montevideo%2C%20Uruguay">Montevideo, Uruguay</a>.
Overview.
The building is inspired in the <a href="Sacr%C3%A9-C%C5%93ur%2C%20Paris">Sacré-Cœur, Paris</a> with some influences of <a href="Hagia%20Sophia">Hagia Sophia</a>, <a href="Constantinople">Constantinople</a>; it bears a free interpretation of the Byzantine style, but built in <a href="brick">brick</a>. Its situation on top of the Cerrito hill makes it one of the most notable landmarks in the Montevidean cityscape.
This temple is a National Sanctuary since 1898, as established by Archbishop <a href="Mariano%20Soler">Mariano Soler</a>. Later, the parish was established on 30 October 1919.
